reviews.review_msg: My favorite professor. His lectures are great. If you find his cmpt 120 is hard, maybe programming is really not your thing.
good

Most patient and hilarious teacher I've ever met!I know nothing about CS before the course,even little in English,but he magically pushes u forward without noticing.Before the final,I got 95% and 3 books as a reward,which comes from his salary.I just want to mention that u can learn more if it's hard to learn,and if u work harder,everything happens
not bad but NOT GOOD.
Great Prof!

His class is great. His slides are perfectly prepared. They have many animations so it is better to save them on laptop or iPad than printing them out. He has many pop quizzes and labs+assignment, but if you attend the class every week, you will be fine. His class is well, very well prepared.

Hard lecture notes, hard assignments, hard midterm, hard final, hard project, and a bad Francophone English, but a nice guy. The final project is incredibly ridiculous --- researching on biology, and writing a 3500 word report, but only considered a bit of coding (and difficult 4 newbies). Its an introductory course of CS, and NOT an advanced CS.

He's a good prof. Course was really hard for an intro, but he did mark fairly and provided a rubric to follow. It was kinda like a bio project. After all the struggling, it was fun after all. Could've made it easier to get bonuses for people to maintain a better grade. As well, more practice on coding would've been good too. Great slides, very good

Not a good teacher for an intro computing class. No textbook or assignment, just very unclear lecture slides are given. The project is way too hard for students who dont really have a lot of programming background before. Just too hard and challenging for intro level.Such a GPA killer this semester!

All i can say about this course taken by him is "LOL". The amount of work needed for a 3 credit course as an "introduction to computer science" was extremely outrageous. Philippe is a really nice guy and stuff and he is helpful but,it's either you know the stuff or you don't. And if you are a computer geek already-you'll be fine(all the geeks did)
Course is over. Still don't know a thing about coding. No homework, no practice-which is critical for this type of course.

I took (and failed...) that course before and I can say this was much much better. I didn't expect to do a project though the guy said it the first day so I'm like ok... But I don't think it was poorly explained cuz we had lots of rubrics with bunch of examples and he met with all of us, plus he answered all my emails fast. So yeah keep it up.

1st 2 assignments were not bad; bonus points reward system was poor though. 3rd project was a totally poorly explained process. In a nutshell, its a proposal paper of a hypothesis you weren't told to make + a program simulation of a bio or cognitive process u believe to be the focus the whole time + a final Thesis Paper (aka:"simulation report")...

The professor is okay. He's obviously very experienced and knowledgeable about the topic and provides very comprehensive materials for the students. However, I think the way he designed the course is too difficult for the students. Wouldve been better if they touched on more applications for design than biology as majority of the students are SIAT

Nice & funny guy, but tough especially for an intro course. Like what others said, final project was more like a Bio project (with a 3.5k-words paper to write). I wish the bonus quizzes worked better - he only gave the bonuses if you got full marks on them, so there's very little chance of pulling grades up for people already suffering low grades.

The material was tough. Most of us were forced to take that class and honestly we'd rather not be here... But the prof really worked to make entertaining lectures! He was very available for help, like he'd come to the labs to give extra help on top of TA, and he gave us a super detailed feedback for the projects.

Extremly hard teacher. Entertaining way of teaching. just too hard.project is hard. assignment is hard.It is intro to computer science and most of us are from SIAT. many people dropped in the beginning of the class. honestly. I like him. but CMPT 120 usually are easier than this. nothing personal. I'm just expecting an easier course

First half of course was well taught, well prepared lectures. Post-midterm was off from computing, more a biology research for Project-was worth a lot and only partially consisted coding. Prof was always available to help, it was the TA who was vague. Should have more assignments instead of huge final and project. Low class average, no curve.

I don't think he deserves as much hate as he is getting. He was really helpful and his slides/lectures were extremely detailed and you could tell a lot of work went into them. I do think the project was a bit ridiculous however and it was too hard for an intro level course. Other than that the hw was fair, but weekly assnmnts would have helped.

Project worth too much and irrelevant to computing science, only 1/3 coding. After midterm there was no more assignments to practice. Everything from then on was trial n error. He was always available for help, however, he still leaves you with quite alot to figure out. First half of the course was good. Project sucked because it was bio project.

He is one of the worst prof's I have ever came across. He spent loads of time on the easy stuff and for the remaining time, he gave an unbelievably hard final project for us to waste our time on. I learned absolutely nothing about programming and now am completely turned off of computing science solely because of him.

Regardless of how helpful he tries to be, he is unclear. Course slides were useful but second half focused too much on himself and his other occupations. Project was irrelevant to course and was too hard to grasp simply because there was more coding for us to figure out than he really prepared us for. I would really like to learn more cmpt.

WORST PROFF EVER!!I have never done so poorly in a course before.His lecture is completely pointless and he doesn't know how to teach at all(his accent makes it ten times worse).He doesn't realize this is an introductory comp course and thinks we are masters students.for your own sake- AVOID at all costs!!(unless you're content with receiving an F)

He spent too much time on the easy stuff, not enough on the hard stuff in his lectures, and he would just sometimes start using new code without even telling us what the code meant. I talked to him about it before, but he didn't change his teaching style at all to help us. His final project was ridiculous and very difficult.

His slides and animations are great for teaching these confusing concepts. He is very willing to help his students. Its unfair that he is receiving all these hateful comments. Maybe some of you will appreciate him once you've had a few more profs at SFU...but i forgive you.

Ridiculous. No weekly homework assignments, no textbook... Irrelvant research project. He's smart, and can be quit helpful if you know what questions to ask, but not a great teacher in general. Very unprofessional in emails. The little bit I learned and actually understood in this class was in result of helpful websites I found by myself.

We had to spend a lot of time doing the final project, which most of us found completely pointless. This isn't a bio or writing class. People would rather spend that time doing coding stuff, but instead it was wasted on that stupid project. Very unprofessional in general and extremely rude in emails.

The material is challenging but the prof supports us a lot. He always answers emails fast, and spent lots of time helping on the projects! I think I learnt a lot on the project... it wasn't easy but that was worth it.

This so-called introductory course is so effing hard. The prof should compare his stupid material with the other NORMAL cmpt120 courses. Even the TA don't understand why we have to do the stupid final project. There was no point to it. He should just continue being a TA instead.He basically ruined everyone's grades.
The final project is ridiculous.

Why in the world is the coding for the final project only worth 5% while the research and presentation  is worth 26%. Is this a bio class!? For CMPT 120 which is suppose to be a somewhat easy introductory course to python this guy has made it HARD. If you are about to take this course with this guy be warned it's not straight up coding like most.
his lecture notes sometimes are unclear, and it's hilarious that the final project is related to biology (only 10% of cs)... overall, he is a nice guy
VERY HARD assignments/exams, but VERY INTERESTING guy!
Great prof. Responds to emails like lightning. The subject isn't all that easy though.

way his class is designed.. people who are getting higher marks will keep getting even higher because most of the bonus are impossible for normal people. He is a great guy though.. very helpful when you ask him questions and he's only like 23! You really learn in his class. I really hope he scales the grades though.. that would make him my fav prof
Really hard final exam. Have some pity on students - After all they are human beings. I beg you to scale the grade marks.
Very nice prof...extremely hard, but teaches a lot. Expects a lot from students. Overall, my grades are low, but he is very likeable.
Pretty tough syllabus but he does give lots of quizzes so you have a chance at pulling your grades up.

Overall, he is a good prof and teaches well in the class. He is very helpful and is available for extra office hours. Assignments and midterm was hard. Well, I hope he was going to curve the final grade of the class b/c barcharts show that around half of the class is failing the midterm, and I am wondering how they are going to get a grade of C & <

he was good for being a TA, but as an instructor, he might be tough (or very tough) for some students. Very helpful tho. MT and quiz are hard...need to write lots of explanation ... maybe i can't get used to his teaching style, coz he makes me really hate comp sci :(

His labs and assignments are extremely long, and often confusing. Don't worry thou, for he answers all your questions almost instantly if you email him, and he gives tons of examples and explainations to help you understand. He gives in-class quizzes to help you boost mark. Lecture notes were awesome. (animated!) And he has a great sense of humor.

tough but fair. this class requires lots of hard work and the assignments demand a lot. but really whats the point in going to university if there is no challenge. This prof tells it like it is. Very thorough in his explanations and provides helpful feedback. Overall good prof.

He is extremely helpful, with quick email responses and easy access in person (he is always at his office). he is also quite clear, always with diagrams. The guy himself is awesome. His tests, labs, and assignments are hard, but fair. If you have trouble, just talk to him to get the problems sorted out.

Assignments and labs are vigorous and extremely challenging for the student comin out of CMPT125. He replies quickly w lot of info when u email him. Mt was HARD, and instead of scaling, he gives HARD inclass quizzes that lets u raise ur mark if you get all the questions correct. No review classes to help w/ MT. lab attendance not mandatory.

Really great teacher with lots of examples.  Class is never too dull.  Would take any other class from him, even if wasn't all that interested in the subject because of how he can make boring stuff more interesting.
Great availability (e-mail, extra appointments, ...). Willing to help. Assignments and labs are a bit long but challenging. Lots of feedback!
Hate this guy! Won't scale even though most of the class failed the midterm.. Horrible prof, inconsiderate of student?s opinion.
